mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (ECADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change. When using ECMOOD, this field should not be used.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When ECADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When ECADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable in SUPPEC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures the reason the dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., adverse event, insufficient response) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses. Used only when an adjustment is represented in EX dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description or explanation of why a dose of the study treatment is adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [(study) treatment/dose] interrupted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if there was an interruption in the study treatment or dosing.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the actual duration of the exposure is collected using the CDASH field ECCINTD. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPPEC.QVAL dataset where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECITRPYN" and SUPPEC.QLABEL = "Exposure Interrupted".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTMIG Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether of not the exposure was interrupted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the duration of the treatment interruption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the duration of treatment interruption.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to collect the duration of treatment interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the treatment start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECITRPD" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create ECITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The collected duration of the treatment interruption.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the interruption duration unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit (e.g., MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS) for the duration of treatment interruption.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The unit should be collected as a qualifier to the number for duration.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECITRPD" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create ECITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for the collected duration of treatment interruption.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose]) administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., SHOULDER, HIP, ARM).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location where the study treatment was administered. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of administration.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose]) administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Left, Right).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Further details the laterality of the location where the study treatment was administered. This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the study treatment administration.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose]) administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Anterior, Lower, Proximal, Upper).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the total amount (Drug + Vehicle) (of [study treatment/dose]) administered?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the total amount (treatment +vehicle) that was administered/given to the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Administration amount that was given to the subject. Note: should not be the diluent amount alone. The ECTRTV field may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTM variable ECTRTV may also be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The amount of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) administered or given.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit for the amount (of [study treatment/dose]) administered?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit of total amount (treatment +vehicle) administered/given to the subject (e.g., mL).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Unit of the administration amount.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of measurement for the prepared product (treatment + vehicle).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [study treatment/dose] infusion rate?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Rate of Infusion (e.g., if rate is 10 mL/min. Record 10 as the infusion rate).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Infusion rate can be used to derive dose.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECFLRT" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.

Description.TranslatedText: Exposure as Collected Infusion Rate Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit for the ([study treatment/dose]) infusion rate?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit for the infusion rate (e.g., mL/min).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Unit of the infusion rate.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM="ECFLRTU" and SUPPEC.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of measure for the flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point for [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point of study treatment administration if not pre-printed on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors ECTPTREF (text description) and ECRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables ECTPTNUM, ECELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject complete the full course of [study treatment/dose]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether subject has completed the full course of treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Depending on how the study treatment details are collected via the CRF/eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEC dataset as the value of SUPPEC.QVAL where SUPPEC.QNAM = "ECTRTCMP" and SUPPEC.QLABEL ="Completed Treatment". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the subject completed the intended regimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the trial epoch?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: [protocol specific]

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the same information is collected more than once in different periods/parts of a study (e.g., Disposition), EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be preprinted on the CRF as the title of the page. See SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Name of the Trial Epoch with which this Element of the Arm is associated.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any[study treatment/dose] taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject took any study medications. If Yes, include the appropriate details where indicated.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.The EXYN variable is a cleaning or EDC convention meant to indicate that the exposure form should be completed or inserted into the case book.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not the subject took study medication/treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the [study treatment/dose] ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the study treatment category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the [study treatment/dose] ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the study treatment subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. EXSCAT can only be used if there is an EXCAT and it must be a subcategorization of EXCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the EXCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [study treatment/investigational product] name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of study treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: EXTRT captures the name of the investigational treatment. This is typically collected for open label studies and populated for blinded studies during the SDTM-based dataset creation. Since EXTRT is the SDTMIG topic variable, it is a required variable in SDTM and must have a value in CDASH or a plan to populate it in the SDTM submission datasets (i.e., collected or populated from other sources).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Name of the study treatment or intervention given per single administration or during the "constant dosing interval" for the observation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [study treatment/dose] label identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record treatment label identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as kit number, bottle label, vial identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lot number of the[study treatment/dose] used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lot number that appears on the container holding the study treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The Lot Number identifies the manufacturing batch of the study treatment. In open label studies, the reference number on the study treatment container may represent an actual Lot Number and is submitted using EXLOT. This variable may be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets. Do not collect other identification variables in this field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Lot Number of the EXTRT product.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the study treatment being taken.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the dose form of the [study treatment/dose] ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose form (e.g., SOLUTION, TABLET, LOTION) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This must be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dosage form in which the EXTRT is physically presented.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (start) date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start date of the study treatment administration using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Date when constant dosing interval of the study treatment started or single administration occurred. When collecting the date for an individual dose, the word "start" may be omitted from the Question Text and Prompt.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The [start] date of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (start) time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the start time (as complete as possible) when administration of study treatment started.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a medication was started only when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The [start] time of the study treatment, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (end) date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date or last date of administration of study treatment using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If start date and end date are not expected to be on the same date, the end date is required. If the study design indicates that the start and end date are on the same day, the end date is not required since it can be assigned to be equal to the start date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of study treatment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ([intended/planned/actual]) ([study treatment/dose]) (end) time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time, (as complete as possible) when study treatment administration stopped (e.g., for infusions this is the time when the infusion ended).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommend collecting the time a medication was ended when a protocol or data collection scenarios requires it. For infusions, the end time of the infusion is typically needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EXENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end time of treatment, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the dose [per administration] (of [study treatment/dose]) ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the dose or amount of study treatment that was administered to/taken by the subject in the period recorded; from the start date/time to the end date/time inclusive.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Dose or amount taken for single administration of study treatment or per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from diary data, drug accountability data, protocol). The data collected in this dose text-format field should be mapped to either SDTMIG variable EXDOSE (if numeric) or EXDOSTXT (if text).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to EXDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to EXDOSTXT in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Dose [per administration].

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit for the dose?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit of dose or amount taken per period recorded (e.g., ng, mg, mg/kg).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Unit of dose or amount taken per constant dosing interval recorded. Dose unit must be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol, randomization data). The unit should be preprinted on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for general dose and volume units.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for intended dose [per administration] for EXDOSE, EXDOSTOT, or EXDOSTXT.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the frequency of[study treatment/dose] dosing?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the frequency the study treatment was administered for a defined period of time.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. When possible, the options for dose/amount frequency are preprinted on the CRF. When collected, the recommendation is to collect dosing information in separate fields (e.g., ECDOSE, ECDOSEU, ECDOSFRQ) for specific and consistent data collection and to enable programmatically utilizing these data.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the route of administration (of the [study treatment/dose] )?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the route of administration (e.g., IV, ORAL, TRANSDERMAL) or enter the appropriate code from the code list.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be collected if it cannot be determined via other methods (e.g., from protocol) or if there are multiple options.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The route of administration of the study treatment.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the intended dose regimen (of the [study treatment/dose] )?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the regimen for the study medication.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The regimen information may further clarify the dose administration and dose frequency (e.g., TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF). This may be preprinted or collected. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the dose adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether there was a change in dosing.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring as it provides a definitive response regarding any dose changes. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (EXADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the dose was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When EXADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When EXADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not the dose was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the dose was adjusted (from planned)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If there was a change in dosing, record the reason for change.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures the reason the dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., adverse event, insufficient response) or entered as free text. May be used for variations from protocol-specified doses, or changes from expected doses.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description or explanation of why a dose of the study treatment is adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [(study) treatment/dose] interrupted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if there was an interruption in the study treatment or dosing.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the actual duration of the exposure is collected using the CDASH field EXCINTD. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPPEX.QVAL dataset where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRPYN" and SUPPEX.QLABEL = "Exposure Interrupted".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTMIG Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether of not the exposure was interrupted.

Question.TranslatedText: If the dose was interrupted, how long was the interruption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the duration of treatment interruption.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In some situations, the duration of the interruption may be calculated from the administration start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM="EXITRPD" and SUPPEX.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The collected duration of the treatment interruption.

Question.TranslatedText: If the dose was interrupted, what were the units for the interruption duration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit (e.g., MINUTES, HOURS, DAYS) for the duration of treatment interruption.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The unit should be collected and converted into ISO 8601 period format.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXITRPD" and SUPPEX.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected treatment interruption duration and the duration unit components and create EXITRPDusing ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for the collected duration of treatment interruption.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose] ) administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., SHOULDER, HIP, ARM).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location where the study treatment was administered. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of administration.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the total amount (Drug + Vehicle)(of [study treatment/dose] ) administered?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the total amount (treatment +vehicle) that was administered/given to the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Administration amount that was given to the subject. Note: should not be the diluent amount alone. The ECTRTV field may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTM variable ECTRTV may also be populated during the process of creating the SDTM submission datasets.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The amount of the prepared product (treatment + vehicle) administered or given.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit for the amount (of [study treatment/dose] ) administered?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit of total amount (treatment +vehicle) administered/given to the subject (e.g., mL).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Unit of the administration amount. A CDASH Subset Controlled Terminology Codelist Name is available for dose and volume units.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of measure for the prepared product (treatment + vehicle).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [study treatment/dose] infusion rate?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Rate of Infusion (e.g., if rate is 10 mL/min. Record 10 as the infusion rate).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Infusion rate can be used to derive dose.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXFLRT" and SUPPEX.QLABEL= "Infusion Rate". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What were the units for the [study treatment/dose] infusion rate?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit for the infusion rate (e.g., mL/min).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Unit of the infusion rate.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM ="EXFLRTU" and SUPPEX.QLABEL="Infusion Rate Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of measure for the flow rate for the total amount of drug + vehicle administered to the subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point for [study treatment/dose] ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point of study treatment administration if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors EXTPTREF (text description) and EXRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EXTPTNUM, EXELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject complete the full course of [study treatment/dose] ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select either Yes or No to indicate whether subject has completed the full course of treatment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Depending on how the study treatment details are collected via the CRF/eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEX dataset as the value of SUPPEX.QVAL where SUPPEX.QNAM = "EXTRTCMP" and SUPPEX.QLABEL=" Completed Treatment". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Subject did not did not complete the intended regimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose] ) administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Left, Right).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Further details the laterality of the location where the study treatment was administered. This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the study treatment administration.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the ([study treatment/dose] ) administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the body location where the study treatment was administered (e.g., Anterior, Lower, Proximal, Upper).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or created during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any surgical, therapeutic, or diagnostic procedures performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the subject had any surgical, therapeutic or diagnostic procedures. If "Yes", include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not the subject had any procedures performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the procedure?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the procedure category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the procedure?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the procedure subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. PRSCAT can only be used if there is a PRCAT and it must be a subcategorization of PRCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the PRCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile procedure records with medical history and/or with AEs. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the procedure name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record only one procedure per line.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In most cases, the verbatim procedure names or therapy will be coded to a standard dictionary (e.g., MedDRA, SNOMED) after the data have been collected on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The verbatim surgical, therapeutic, or diagnostic procedure's name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is typically not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the procedure, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process. If PRPRESP is used, and the information about a specific standardized procedure name is being solicited, the data from PRTRT may map directly to the SDTMIG PRDECOD variable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dictionary- or sponsor-defined standardized text description of PRTRT, or the modified topic variable (PRMODIFY), if applicable.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that will appear on the CRF. If the sponsor chooses to code the procedure, the sponsor will populate this through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for PRTERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For prespecified interventions, a hidden field on a CRF defaulted to "Y", or added during the SDTM dataset creation. If a study collects both prespecified interventions as well as free-text interventions, the value of PRPRESP should be "Y" for all prespecified interventions and null for interventions reported as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.

Question.TranslatedText: Was [PRDECOD/PRTRT] performed?; Has the subject had [PRDECOD/PRTRT]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if [specific procedure] was performed by checking Yes or No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: PROCCUR is used to report the occurrence of a prespecified procedure or a group of procedures. PROCCUR is not used for spontaneously free text-reported procedures. The site should be able to indicate that the response was not asked or answered.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. If the response was not asked or answered, populate the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT with "NOT DONE".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether a prespecified procedure (PRTRT) happened when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason that the procedure was (not) performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate why the procedure was or wasnot performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the scheduled procedure was or was not performed may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., SUBJECT REFUSED) or entered as free text. When --REASOC is used, --OCCUR must also be populated in the SDTM dataset with a value of "Y" or "N".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM = "PRREASOC" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Reason for Occur Value". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why a scheduled procedure did or did not occur.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason not done?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why the procedure was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PRREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset. The value "NOT DONE" here indicates that the subject was not questioned/data was not collected. It does not mean that the subject did not have the procedure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the procedure performed prior to [PRSTTPT]?; Was the procedure performed prior to study start?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check if the procedure was started before the specified point in time.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and and SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.4.7 for more information. for information about mapping relative times.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTM relative timing variable such as PRSTRF or PRSTRTPT. When populating PRSTRF, or PRSTRTPT, if the value of the CDASH field PRPRIOR is "Y" a value from the CDISC CT (STENRF) may be used. When PRPRIOR refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRSTRF should be populated. When PRPRIOR is compared to another time point, the SDTM variables PRSTRTPT and PRSTTPT should be used. Note: PRSTRTPT must refer to the time point anchor described in PRSTTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the procedure occurred prior to [PRSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the procedure (start) date ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the procedure was started or performed using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). Procedures performed during the study are expected to have a complete start date. Prior procedures that are exclusionary should have both a start and end date.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The preferred method is to collect a complete Start Date. Partial dates (e.g., providing year only) for procedures started a considerable amount of time prior to the start of study are acceptable.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PRSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date or start date of when the procedure started or was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the procedure ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the procedure has not ended at the time of data collection and the end date should be left blank.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Completed to indicate that the procedure has not stopped at the time point defined by the study. The purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring; this field provides further confirmation that the End Date was deliberately left blank. See Section 3.7, Mapping Relative Times from Collection to Submissions, and and SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.4.7 for more information. for information about mapping relative times.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into an SDTMIG relative timing variable such as PRENRF or PRENRTPT. When populating PRENRF, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "DURING", "AFTER" or "DURING/AFTER" may be used. When populating PRENRTPT, if the value of PRONGO is "Y", the value of "ONGOING" may be used. When PRONGO refers to the Study Reference Period (defined in DM.RFSTDTC to DM.RFENDTC) the SDTM variable PRENRF should be populated. When PRONGO is used in conjunction with another time point, the SDTM variables PRENRTPT and PRENTPT should be used. Note: PRENRTPT must refer to a time point anchor described in PRENTPT.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication the procedure is ongoing when no end date is provided.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the procedure (end) date?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the end date of the procedure using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the procedure has not ended, leave this field blank and populate PRONGO as "Y".

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The assumption is that sponsors should either have an End Date or will indicate that the procedure was ongoing at the time of collection or at the end of the study. However, in cases where the End Date can be determined from dates collected elsewhere in the CRF it is not necessary to include an End Date in the CRF. For example, if the procedure is started and stopped within the same day, the End Date will be the same as the Start Date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable PRENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of the procedure, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: For what indication was the [PRTRT] performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reason the procedure was performed based on clinical investigator's evaluation. If performed to treat a condition, and a diagnosis was made, the indication should be the diagnosis. If performed to treat a condition, and no diagnosis was made, the indication should be the signs and symptoms. If taken as prophylaxis, report as "Prophylaxis for " and include a description of the condition(s).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This additional information is collected on the CRF when the sponsor wants to capture the reason(s) why a procedure was performed. This information can then be used as deemed appropriate for coding, analysis (e.g., in the classification of procedures), for reconciling the procedures performed on a subject with their provided medical history, and/or AEs/SAEs as part of the data clean-up and monitoring process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The condition, disease, symptom, or disorder that the procedure was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered, why the procedure was performed).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier of the adverse event for which this procedure was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent is to establish a link between the adverse event and the procedure performed for the adverse event. PRAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the PR dataset and records in the AE dataset. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this procedure.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the medical history event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier of the medical history event for which this procedure was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent is to establish a link between the medical history condition and the procedure undergone for the medical history condition. PRMHNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the PR dataset and records in the MH dataset. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Medical History domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the medical history event that is the indication for this procedure.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [dose/amount] of [PRTRT] (per administration/for the procedure)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [dose/amount] of [PRTRT] per administered.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Defining this data collection field as a dose text field allows for flexibility in capturing dose entries as numbers, text or ranges. The data collected in this dose text-format field should be separated or mapped to either SDTMIG PRDOSE if numeric or PRDOSTXT if text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. Numeric values map to PRDOSE in SDTM. Non-numeric values (e.g., 200-400) map to PRDOSTXT in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The dose/amount administered during the procedure.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit for the amount of [PRTRT] performed or administered.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When sponsors collect data for amount of [PRTRT] performed or administered, Unit should be collected as well (if applicable).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for intended dose/amount for PRDOSE, PRDOSTOT, or PRDOSTXT.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the frequency of [PRTRT]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record how often the procedure was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be collected if it cannot be determined from other sources or if there are multiple options. Usually expressed as the number of procedures given per a specific interval.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The number/amount of the procedure that was given/administered/taken during a specific interval.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the route of administration of the procedure?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the route of administration for the procedure.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This additional information may be important to collect on the CRF when the sponsor would want to capture a procedure's route of administration for comparative analysis purposes.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The route of administration of the procedure.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the procedure was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the body location where the procedure was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., Liver for the Biopsy). LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of an procedure, such as location of a biopsy.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the administration?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location where the procedure was administered.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Further details the laterality of the location where the procedure was administered/taken. This may be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the procedure administration.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the procedure?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the direction of the anatomical location where the procedure was administered.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location that was treated?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the portion of the body location that was treated.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the procedure being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the procedure may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all procedures.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the intended procedure regimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the intended regimen for the procedure to be performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The regimen information may further clarify the dose administration and dose frequency (e.g., TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF). This may be prespecified or collected. The sponsor may wish to create a codelist to collect this data consistently.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the procedure.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the procedure dose adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the procedure was adjusted from planned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Typically, the intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that the associate field on the CRF (PRADJ) was deliberately left blank. However, the sponsor may collect whether the procedure dose/amount was adjusted, without collecting the reason for the change.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: When PRADJ is collected, does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED. When PRADJ is not collected, the sponsor may submit this variable as a SUPPQ.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not the procedure dose/amount was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the procedure dose was adjusted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record why the procedure dose was adjusted from planned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures reason [PRTRT] dose was changed or modified. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., adverse event, insufficient response) or entered as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description or explanation of why a procedure dose/amount was adjusted.

Question.TranslatedText: Did the subject complete the full course of the [PRTRT]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the subject completed the intended regimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Depending on how the [PTTRT] dose details are collected via the CRF/eCRF, it may be possible to derive those data if the regimen data are collected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM= "PRTRTCMP" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Treatment Completed". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the subject completed the intended regimen.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the procedure interrupted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record if the procedure was interrupted.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides a definitive response regarding any procedure interruption. The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring when the duration of the interruption is collected. In some situations, if the actual duration of the interruption is not collected, or not derived, this information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the procedure was interrupted.

Question.TranslatedText: Why was the procedure interrupted?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reason the procedure was interrupted.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH field is use to collected the reason why an intervention was interrupted. The sponsor may define controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRITRPRS" and SUPPPR.QLABEL ="Reason Intervention Interrupted". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of why the intervention was interrupted.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the duration of the procedure interruption?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record how long the procedure was interrupted before it resumed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to collect the duration of procedure interruption. In some situations, the duration of the interruption may not be collected but calculated from the procedure start and end times recorded elsewhere in the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected procedure interruption duration and the duration unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The collected duration of the procedure interruption.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the interruption duration unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unit for the duration of interruption of the procedure.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The unit should be collected as a qualifier to the number for duration.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRITRPD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL= "Interruption Duration". Concatenate the collected procedure interruption duration and the duration unit components and create PRITRPD using ISO 8601 Period format. Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit for the collected duration of the procedure interruption.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete Data Management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for coding. Another dictionary can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRLLT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Lower Level Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA text description of the Lowest Level Term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRLLTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Lower Level Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR.QVAL dataset where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRPTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL= "Preferred Term Code Lower Level Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA code for the Preferred Term.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRHLT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA text description of High Level Term from the primary path.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR.QVAL dataset where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRHLTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA High Level Term code from the primary path.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRHLTGT" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Group Term". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA text description of the High Level Group Term from the primary path.

Description.TranslatedText: Procedure High Level Group Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM= "PRHLTGTCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="High Level Group Term Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR.QVAL dataset where SUPPPR.QNAM="PRSOC" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Primary System Organ Class". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class description associated with the intervention.

Description.TranslatedText: PR Primary System Organ Class Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using the MedDRA coding dictionary. Rationale for adding coding variables to CDASH is to provide a more complete data management package. This variable could be used in the PR domain for MedDRA coding. Other dictionaries can be used and the appropriate coding elements added, if appropriate, in the SUPPPR.QVAL dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This information could be submitted in a SUPPPR dataset as the value of SUPPPR.QVAL where SUPPPR.QNAM= "PRSOCCD" and SUPPPR.QLABEL="Primary System Organ Class Code". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains. Sponsors should include an Origin column in the SUPPQ dataset to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class code.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?
