Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA text description of the High Level Group Term from the primary path.

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event High Level Group Term Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event Primary System Organ Class

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class description associated with the event.

Description.TranslatedText: MH Event Primary System Organ Class Code

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field does not typically appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. This is applicable to items using MedDRA coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to code utilizing the Define-XML external codelist attributes. Sponsors should include an Origin in the define metadata document to indicate that the data was "ASSIGNED".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: MedDRA code for the primary System Organ Class.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, see SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the DA CRF using the date (DADAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was drug accountability performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented on a CRF page level on a visit-by-visit basis. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF="N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF="Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned drug accountability assessment was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the type of treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type of treatment dispensed/returned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it can be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. See SDTMIG DA domain for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed/returned (e.g., Bottle A, Bottle B).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. If it is known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate, but different, than DACAT grouping values). See SDTMIG DA domain for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the drug accountability assessment was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the exact date the study treatment was (dispensed or returned), using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the treatment label identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record treatment label identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to tie together a block of related records and to link dispensed product to returned product. This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional identifier variables.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as treatment label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the drug accountability being assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the drug accountability assessment if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header. For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable DATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in the CDASH field DATEST. The SDTMIG variables DATESTCD and DATEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding (e.g., dispensed, returned).

Description.TranslatedText: DA Assessment Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the result of the drug accountability assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the actual amount of treatment dispensed or returned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the drug accountability assessment as originally dispensed or returned (e.g., actual amount).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the death details assessments were reported can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Death Detail CRF using the date (DDDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DDCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any death detail assessments collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the death details are known. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: General prompt question regarding whether or not any death details were available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date death detail assessments were collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Since SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subject's date of death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of death.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the Sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date of death for any subject who died.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the death detail assessment test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the death detail assessment if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Test can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable DDTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in DDTEST. Both DDTESTCD and DDTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for death details

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail response.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the death detail assessment information?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the inclusion and exclusion assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Inclusion/Exclusion CRF using the date (IEDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable IEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were all eligibility criteria met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record Yes if all eligibility criteria were met at the time the subject was enrolled. Record No if subject did not meet all criteria at the time the subject was enrolled.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the subject met all the eligibility requirements for this study at the time the subject was enrolled.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the eligibility criteria assessment was performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record complete date when the eligibility assessment was performed using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable IEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection of the inclusion/exclusion criteria represented in an unambiguous date format. (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the criterion?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the criterion exception was Inclusion or Exclusion. Checkbox: Check Inclusion or Exclusion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: These categories have been defined in SDTM and have controlled terminology that must be used. Only records for criteria that are not met appear in the IE SDTMIG domain. IECAT must be populated. This criterion category may be collected on the CRF in a checkbox format or it may be included as part of the Criterion Identification and mapped when the SDTM submission datasets are created.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping category to denote whether the protocol entry criterion being assessed is Inclusion Criteria or Exclusion Criteria

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the criterion?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header This can be used to distinguish criteria for a sub-study or to categorize the criteria as a major or minor exception.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the IECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met ?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If the subject was not eligible, Record the identifying code for each criterion that was an exception.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is required to appear on the CRF, but may be null if there are no exceptions to the inclusion/exclusion criteria. The CRF should allow multiple exceptions to be recorded. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 7.5.2 for assumptions regarding protocol versioning. Sponsors may provide a list of inclusion/ exclusion criteria and the unique identifying codes to the site. The list provided should be versioned/updated when the protocol changes and the criteria are changed. Sponsors should use sponsor-developed controlled terminology for IETESTCD.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unique identifier associated with the criterion that was the exception.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the description of the inclusion criterion the subject did not meet or the exclusion criterion the subject met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the description of the criterion, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors could automatically populated the text in EDC systems when the Criterion Identifier is populated by the investigator. This can be verified by the PI to ensure the right Exception Identifier was selected.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable IETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in IETEST. The SDTMIG variables IETESTCD and IETEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the inclusion or exclusion criterion that was the exception.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is only a data collection field when a complete list of inclusion and exclusion criteria are included on the CRF with Yes/No response options. If the sponsor collects only the criteria that are not fulfilled then, when an Inclusion Criteria is not met, IEORRES is mapped to "N" and when an Exclusion Criteria is met, IEORRES is mapped to "Y".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of which Inclusion criterion was not met or Exclusion criterion was met.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the reproductive system findings were collected can be determined from the Visit Data variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the reproductive system findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the RP CRF using the date (RPDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the reproductive system?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reproductive system category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the reproductive system?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the reproductive system subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. RPSCAT can only be used if there is an RPCAT and it must be a subcategorization of RPCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the RPCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was a reproductive system evaluation performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not a planned reproductive system evaluation was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for a series of reproductive system evaluations, or a specific reproductive system test. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RPSTAT. If the CDASH field RPPERF="N", the value of RPSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RPPERF="Y", RPSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., RPCAT and RPSCAT, RPTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD would be populated as RPALL and an appropriate test name (RPTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the reproductive system test was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the measurement or test was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: Were there any reproductive system findings?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the there are reproductive system findings. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: General prompt question regarding whether or not there are any reproductive system findings available.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the reproductive finding name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the reproductive system finding if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable RPTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RPTEST. The SDTMIG variables RPTESTCD and RPTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for Reproductive System Finding.

Description.TranslatedText: RP Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result for the reproductive system question?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record reproductive system finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the finding defined in reproductive system finding, as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the reproductive system question was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This should be a complete date. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable RPDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date on which the reproductive system result or finding was collected, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY) .

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the date the tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (RSDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as RSDTC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable RSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Description.TranslatedText: Category for Response or Clin Class

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [category/ criteria] for the [disease response/clinical classification] or What is the [response/clinical classification] criteria?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response is typically a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. There are separate codelists used for categorizations of records about oncology response criteria (ONCRCAT) or other clinical classification (CRSCAT). Collect if multiple clinical classifications, or disease responses are active in a single study/database; otherwise, information should be distinguished somewhere on a form (e.g., table name, title, tab).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Description.TranslatedText: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class

Question.TranslatedText: What is the sub -category for the [disease response/clinical classification]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. RSSCAT can only be used if there is an RSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of RSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the RSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [(disease) response/clinical classification] assessment performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be one check box for each measurement. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT. If RSPERF="N", the value of RSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RSPERF="Y", RSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., RSCAT and RSSCAT, RSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD would be populated as RSALL and an appropriate test name (RSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned disease response or clinical classification assessment was performed.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done

Question.TranslatedText: Why was the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment not performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If the response was not collected, indicate why.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (e.g., Not Imaged, Patient Refusal, Site Error) or entered as free text. When RSREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the role of the person performing the [disease response/clinical classifiaction] assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate who performed the assessment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (assigned by a person or a group). RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be null when the investigator provides all the data in a study. It should contain no null values when data from 1 of more evaluator are used in a study.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID

Question.TranslatedText: What is the evaluator identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Identify the evaluator providing this evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When multiple assessors play the role identified in RSEVAL, values of RSEVALID will attribute a row of data to a particular assessor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Link ID

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ]Link ID Identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ] Link ID Identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKID.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link the disease response assessment to the related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Link Group

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link Group Identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ] Link Group Identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link a group of records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKGRP.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping identifier used to link the disease response assessment to a group of related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the RS test, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RSTEST. The SDTMIG variables RSTESTCD and RSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the disease response or clinical classification used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Original Result

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the response classification

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the disease response or clinical classification as originally received, collected,or calculated.

Description.TranslatedText: Response or Clin Class Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the subject characteristics were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the subject characteristics at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the SC CRF using the date (SCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the subject characteristics?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristics category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the subject characteristics?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristics subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. SCSCAT can only be used if there is an SCCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SCCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the SCCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were subject characteristics collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if subject characteristics information was collected. If yes, record the appropriate details.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SCSTAT. If SCPERF="N", the value of SCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If SCPERF="Y", SCSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SCCAT and SCSCAT, SCTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD would be populated as SCALL and an appropriate test name (SCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not any subject characteristics were collected.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date the subject characteristic(s) was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date the subject characteristic(s) was collected using the format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of collection can be determined from a collected date of the visit (VISDAT) and in such cases a date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the Subject Characteristics name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the Subject Characteristics if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in SCTEST. The SDTMIG variables SCTESTCD and SCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the subject characteristic of interest.

Description.TranslatedText: SC Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject's characteristic?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristic.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the subject characteristic as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the date the test was collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (TRDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the vist date as TRDTC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable TRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/lesion] [link group] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has the appropriate identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because TRLNKGRP is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. This is typically used in oncology clincial trials. It is intended to group all the assessments at a evaluation time point represented in the TR domain with the associated response assessments represented in the RS domain.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link related records across domains.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the [tumor/lesion] results?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Tumor/Lesion Result category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the [tumor/lesion] results?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Tumor/Lesion Result subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. TRSCAT can only be used if there is an TRCAT and it must be a subcategorization of TRCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A subgrouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [tumor/lesion] evaluation was not done.

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [Tumor/Lesion] evaluation was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be one check box for each result. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site record the value as "Not Done".

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason that the [tumor/lesion] was not [evaluated/assessed]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the result was not provided.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology may be used. The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined codelist (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When TRREASND is used, TRSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the information? OR Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the procedure used for [tumor/lesion] assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when the method used to assess the tumor/lesion occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to evaluate the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TRDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the procedure used for tumor/lesion assessment, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/lesion] Identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor /lesion. Note: This variable may be collected using one CDASH variable name (e.g., TULNKID) and populated into TRLNKID when the submisson datasets are created.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [tumor/ lesion] (assessment) test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the tumor lesion assessment, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable TRTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TRTEST. The SDTMIG variables TRTESTCD and TRTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
