mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: TR Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the result for the [tumor/lesion assessment]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Tumor/Lesion Assessment result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Result of the tumor/lesion assessment. Both quantitative and qualitatve results may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. In addition to the SDTMIG variable TRORRES, create TRTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of TRTEST from TRTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the TRTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the tumor/lesion assessment.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the [result/measurement]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Usually the unit of the test is preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the date the test was collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (TUDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as TUDTC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), then concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the [tumor/lesion] identification?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Tumor Identification category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the sub -category for the [tumor/lesion] identification?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Tumor Identification subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This is most commonly preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. TUSCAT can only be used if there is an TUCAT and it must be a subcategorization of TUCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the TUCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were any [target/non-target/new/sponsor-defined) [tumors/lesions] identified?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the there are [tumors/lesions] identified. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is intended to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing tumor/lesions evaluations are confirmed missing. The sponsor may decide to map "No" responses using the appropriate SDTMIG variables. Typically, this would use the SDTMIG variable, TUOCCUR, with an appropriate TUTEST.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Not Submitted.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not any tumors were identified.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the [examination/procedure] used for [tumor/lesion] identification?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the scan/image/physical exam date used to identify the tumor/lesion using this format (DD-MON-YYYY.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is the date of the scan/image/physical exam used to identified the tumor/lesion. It is not the date the MRI or scan was read. This is typically not the visit date.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable TUDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the [examination/procedure] used for tumor/lesion identification, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the information?; or Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of CT on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier of the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the unique identifier assigned to the person making the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect if multiple evaluators are used in the study (may be omitted if multiple evaluators are not used); values should follow controlled terminology.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the [Tumor/Lesion] (link) identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected, record the unique identifier for this tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable is used to provide a unique code for each identified tumor in order to link records across related CRFs (TU and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating --LNKID. Typically, the lesion/tumor is assigned the --LNKID at baseline when the tumor/lesion is identified, and the this --LNKID is used at other visits to collect assessments on this tumor/lesion.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link identified tumor/lesion to the assessment result.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the procedure used to identify this tumor?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the procedure [ID or Line Number] used to evaluate the tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Intent is to establish a link between the TU identified and the procedure undergone to identify this tumor/lesion. TUPRNO can be used to identify a relationship between records in the TU dataset and records in the PR dataset. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the PR domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The identifier for the procedure used to identify the tumor.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used to [evaluate/identify] the tumor/lesion?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used to evaluate/identify the tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The method used to identify the tumor/lesions. Sponsors may collect the method using a codelist which includes the most commonly known/generally recognized terms. The values will represent the method generically, not the product of the method (e.g., photograph) A sponsor may customize or restrict the list of values per response criteria or protocol needs. At a minimum, the primary method of identification should be entered and is expected to be consistent throughout the study; recording secondary methods is at the discretion of the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTM Target".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the procedure [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the internal or external identifier assigned to the procedure/method used to identify the tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This variable may be used to collect a reference/accession number associated with the method used to identify the tumor/lesion. A sponsor may also decide to use the CDASH variable TUPRNO as an identifier for the procedure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as image ID number (e.g., CT scan, MRI, ultrasound identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the tumor/lesion Identification test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the TU test, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable TUTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in TUTEST. The SDTMIG variables TUTESTCD and TUTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [type/classification] of [tumor/lesion] as defined by the criteria being employed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Tumor Identification classification. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD], for example, TUMERGE, TUSPLIT, TUMIDENT or [TESTCD]_TUORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the TU test code. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the tumor identification (e.g., classification or type of tumor).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the [tumor/lesion] identified?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location. A location detail text field (TULOCDTL) is conditional for entry (i.e., can be left blank) and allows the study site to specify the lesion in its own terms or can be used to distinguish tumors within the same location if other location qualifiers are not specific enough.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the identified tumor/lesion.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the laterality of the anatomical location?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the body within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality within the anatomical location of the identified [tumor/lesion].

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What [were/are] additional details on the exact location of the tumor so that it can be distinguished from other tumors in the same anatomical location?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Describe additional detail on the exact location of the tumor so that it can be distinguished from other tumors in the same anatomical location.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Use if TULOC and TULAT and/or TUDIR values cannot provide uniqueness from other identified tumors. TULOCDTL is not meant to replace TULOC, TULAT, and/or TUDIR or serve as the free-text description field for TULOC (e.g., Location, Other).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPTU dataset as the value of SUPPTU.QVAL where SUPPTU.QNAM="TULOCDTL" and SUPPTU.QLABEL= "TU Identification Location Detail".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A detail description of the location of the identified tumor/lesion.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the vendor providing the evaluation.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if vendor names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple vendors are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the VS measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the VS CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were vital signs performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital signs were collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF="Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name VSTEST provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of measurement can be determined from a collected date of visit (VISDAT) and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Description.TranslatedText: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for vital signs, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the vital signs?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital signs category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital signs subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the repetition number of the measurement within the time point.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The repetition number of the test/measurement within the time point may be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., multiple measurements of blood pressure, multiple analyses of a sample).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM= "VSREPNUM" and SUPPVS.QLABEL= "Repetition Number within time point". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the vital sign test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the vital sign test if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in VSTEST. Both VSTESTCD and VSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital sign measurement was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was NOT DONE. Typically, there would be one check box for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual vital signs tests to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

Description.TranslatedText: VS Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital sign result.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether vital sign result was clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM = "VSCLSIG" and SUPPVS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g. SITTING).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the DA CRF using the date (DADAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the test group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on this horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.

Question.TranslatedText: Was [DATEST] collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of DAPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DAPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF="N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF="Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned drug accountability assessment was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the type of treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type of study treatment for which drug accountability is assessed (e.g., STUDY MEDICATION, RESCUE MEDICATION, COMPARATOR, PLACEBO).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of study treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. The value of DACAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DACAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 6.3.8.2 for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed (e.g., DRUG A, DRUG B, BOTTLE 1).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. If it is known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate, but different than, DACAT grouping values). The value of DASCAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DASCAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG Section 6.3 for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the [DATEST] treatment label identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record dispensed treatment label identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF, scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in EX domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as treatment label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date [DATEST] drug accountability was assessed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date drug accountability was performed, using this format ( DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed. A single date may be collected for all the observations when they are performed on the same date. The date of each observation can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DADAT. The date of the observation may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Description.TranslatedText: DA Assessment Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the amount of the [DATEST] drug accountability assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the result of the drug accountability assessment.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] ( e.g., RETAMT) or [TESTCD]_DAORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DA test code (e.g., RETAMT_DAORRES). For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation and return. For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to link related records. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. In addition to the SDTMIG variable DAORRES, create DATESTCD from the CDASH variable name and derive the value of DATEST from DATESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the DATEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the drug accountability assessment (e.g., actual amount).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the [DATEST] result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The unit should be preprinted on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model, Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the death details assessments were reported can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit or the collection date can be included on the Death Detail CRF using the date (DDDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were any death detail assessments collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the death details are known. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The intent/purpose of collecting this field is to help with data cleaning and monitoring. It provides verification if all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM Annotated CRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: General prompt question regarding whether or not any death details were available.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the category of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subcategory of the death detail assessment?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header DDSCAT can only be used if there is an DDCAT and it must be a subcategorization of DDCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the DDCAT values based on user defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date [DTHDX] assessment was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single date may be collected for all death detail assessments when they are collected on the same date. The date of collection of each assessment can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DTHDXCD]_DDDAT. The date of the assessment may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DDDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subject's date of death?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of death.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The CDASH model defines Death Date as a timing variable; this is not included as a timing variable in the SDTMIG. It may be collected on any CRF deemed appropriate by the Sponsor, but should only be collected once. The SDTMIG variable DTHDTC is mapped to the DM domain during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. The SDTMIG variable DM.DTHFLG is not a CDASH variable, but it is typically populated during the SDTM submission dataset creation process. Death Date may be mapped to other SDTM domains, as deemed appropriate by the sponsor (e.g., DS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTM variable DTHDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date of death for any subject who died.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the death detail assessment result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the death detail response.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] (e.g., PRCDTH) or [TESTCD]_DDORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DD test code e.g., PRCDTH_DDORRES. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. In addition to the SDTMIG variable DDORRES, create DDTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of DDTEST from DDTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the DDTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the death detail assessment, as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the death detail assessment information?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the information.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not an ECG or specific ECG test was done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire ECG, or a specific ECG test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable EGSTAT. If the CDASH field EGPERF= "N", the value of EGSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If EGPERF = "Y", EGSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., EGCAT and EGSCAT, EGTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD would be populated as EGALL and an appropriate test name (EGTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned ECG measurement, series of ECG measurements, tests, or observations was performed

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (ECG) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer if this reference ID happens to be available to the site at the time of collection. It can also be used to link the clinical significance assessment to the proper record in the electronic data. (e.g., UUID for external waveform file, session number automatically generated by electronic equipment).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier of the ECG (e.g., waveform number).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method used for the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One possible condition is the method used to collect or calculate the ECG data. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the method used matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: * Method of ECG is provided as part of the electronic data. * Method of ECG is not pertinent to the protocol. * The protocol specifies only one possible method for collecting ECG measurements and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG using the incorrect method.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of the subject during the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether conditions for ECG as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then this question may be included to confirm that the subject's position matches the protocol. The following are examples of when it is not necessary to collect these data on the CRF: * Position of the Subject is provided as part of the electronic data. * Position of the Subject is not pertinent to the protocol. * The protocol specifies only one possible position and the sponsor does not feel there is significant risk of the sites performing the ECG with the subject in the wrong position.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during the ECG measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date the ECG was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date the ECG was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the ECG measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time point labels for when the ECG test should be taken, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the ECG measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the ECG measurements at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the ECG CRF using the date (EGDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the ECG finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header EGSCAT can only be used if there is an EGCAT and it must be a subcategorization of EGCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the EGCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

SDTMIG time point anchors EGTPTREF (text description) and EGRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables EGTPTNUM, EGELTM.
