Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the ECG test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the ECG measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable EGTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in EGTEST. The SDTMIG variables EGTESTCD and EGTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: ECG Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test results, interpretations or findings.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the ECG results?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be included if quantitative results are recorded. Because units for quantitative ECG results are typically limited, units should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than having the sites record the units. This item is not necessary for qualitative results.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether ECG results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEG dataset as the value of SUPPEG.QVAL where SUPPEG.QNAM ="EGCLSIG" and SUPPEG.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the ECG results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time the ECG was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time the ECG was done (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable EGDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Time of ECG, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: Who provided the information?; Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the interpretation of the ECG?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record overall interpretations of the ECG.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The overall interpretation of an ECG is mapped into the appropriate SDTM test and result variables. See the SDTMIG EG Domain for details.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, the recorded interpretation is populated into the SDTMIG variable EGORRES where EGTEST= "Interpretation", and EGTESTCD="INTP".

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Overall interpretation of the result of the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the ECG clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether ECG results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Could apply to specific measurements or to overall interpretation. In this scenario, clinical significance could be provided by the investigator.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPEG dataset as the value of SUPPEG.QVAL where SUPPEG.QNAM = "EGCLSIG" and SUPPEG.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the ECG results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Intent is to establish a link between the clinically significant ECG finding and the medical history event that was reported. EGMHNO can be used in RELREC to identify a relationship between records in EG dataset and records in the MH dataset. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Medical History domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the medical history event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Identifier for the adverse event that was the reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Intent is to establish a link between the clinically significant ECG finding and the AE that was reported. EGAENO can be used to identify a relationship between records in EG dataset and records in the AE dataset. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 8.2 for information on RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission datasets, may be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in the Adverse Events domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Identifier for the adverse event that was reported as a clinically significant ECG finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the laboratory tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an Lab entire panel, or on a specific lab test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, tests, observations or was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when specimen collection was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category/subcategory (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g. Electrolytes, Liver Function). This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See the SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of the laboratory tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire lab panel, or on a specific lab test basis. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF="N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF="Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when the specimen collection was done using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology (e.g. Electrolytes, Liver Function). This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lab test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the Lab measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record laboratory test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Optional if already provided from central lab.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the lab result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Optional if already provided from central lab or a sponsor stored units separately.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether laboratory test results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Key data collected in this scenario.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM ="LBCLSIG" and SUPPLB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of Test or Examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of the laboratory tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the laboratory tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the Laboratory CRF using the date (LBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not lab specimen was collected or measurement performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel, or on a specific test basis. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable LBSTAT. If the CDASH variable LBPERF = "N", the value of LBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If LBPERF = "Y", LBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., LBCAT and LBSCAT, LBTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD would be populated as LBALL and an appropriate test name (LBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG LBDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis or a specimen is collected over an extended time period.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable LBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBCAT and or LBSCAT should be included if lab status (NOT DONE) is collected for each lab category (e.g., HEMATOLOGY, CHEMISTRY, URINALYSIS).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lab test subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. Laboratory tests have commonly recognized categories and subcategories that should be used whenever appropriate. LBSCAT can only be used if there is an LBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of LBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for the lab test, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. SDTMIG time point anchors LBTPTREF (text description) and LBRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables LBTPTNUM, LBELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the laboratory test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM = "LBCOND" and SUPPLB.LABEL="Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. Results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met. When local processing is used, sponsors may not routinely collect specimen condition.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lab test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the Lab measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable LBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in LBTEST. The SDTMIG variables LBTESTCD and LBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record laboratory test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of Test or Examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the lab result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some lab tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., urine color).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the lab result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The collected, non-standard unit(s) should be reported as an equivalent standard unit in LBORRESU.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. The collected, non-standard unit(s) may be submitted in a supplemental qualifier dataset.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received if it were collected as a non-standard unit.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the Toxicity Grade?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the Toxicity Grade.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is commonly used in oncology trials but sponsors may not collect these toxicity grades on CRFs. Terminology codes lists (TOXGRV3) and (TOXGRV4) are available for use.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).

Question.TranslatedText: What is the description of the toxicity?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the description of the toxicity.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This would typically be the text description quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., HYPERCALCEMIA, HYPOCALCEMIA)

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The sponsor is expected to provide the toxicity scale name and version used to map the terms utilizing the Define-XML external code list attributes.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the lower limit of the reference range for this lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the lower limit of the reference range of the lab test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.

Description.TranslatedText: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit

Question.TranslatedText: What was the high limit of the reference range for this lab test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the upper limit of the reference range of the lab test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI should be populated only for continuous results; LBSTNRC should be populated only for non-continuous results. These data may be obtained from the lab or the electronic equipment. These data could be determined from a site or lab specific set of normal ranges stored in a look up table. See the SDTMIG for details on mapping and selecting the proper variable name.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.

Question.TranslatedText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record where the lab result fell with respect to the reference range (e.g. HIGH, LOW, ABNORMAL).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Reference ranges may be defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI or other objective criteria. Typically for local processing "Reference Range Indicator" may be derived or determined programmatically and is not collected on the CRF. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.

Question.TranslatedText: Was this result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether lab results were clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be included if required by the protocol.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPLB dataset as the value of SUPPLB.QVAL where SUPPLB.QNAM= "LBCLSIG" and SUPPLB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the laboratory used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date that the Microbiology Findings were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microbiology Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was [specimen type] collected or [test topic] performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microbiology specimen was collected

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MBSTAT is populated using the CDASH field MBPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MBREASND).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF = "N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF = "Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, tests or observations was performed or specimen was collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection ,represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date that the Microbiology Specimen was collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microbiology Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microbiology Findings CRF using the date (MBDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microbiology examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microbiology examination performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MBSTAT. If MBPERF="N", the value of MBSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MBPERF="Y", MBSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MBCAT and MBSCAT, MBTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD would be populated as MBALL and an appropriate test name (MBTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimen was collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g., line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology specimen or result record has a unique identifier that will link records across domains.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: SDTMIG v3.2 uses --GRPID as the variable that links the Microbiology Specimen/Result domain (MB) with the Microbiology Susceptibility domain (MS). In RELREC, this one-to-many relationship may be represented with a simple 2-record dataset-to-dataset RELREC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A group identifier used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] link identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology specimen or result record has a unique identifier that will link records across domains.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be a one-to-one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, a single microbiology specimen or result may have multiple measurements/assessments performed (e.g., susceptibility testing).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTM Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link related records across domains.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MBDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the Microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the Microbiology finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MBSCAT can only be used if there is an MBCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MBCAT.
