mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the Microbiology examination test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable MBTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MBTEST. Both MBTESTCD and MBTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the Microbiology test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the Microbiology examination detail?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the microbiology examination, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides additional details for the microbiology examination. It is recommended that the test detail be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Detail of the Microbiology examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: MB Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test result, interpretation or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., where MBTEST="Microbial Organism Identification").

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMB dataset as the value of SUPPMB.QVAL where SUPPMB.QNAM = "MBCLSIG" and SUPPMB.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result category?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the category of the test results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., INFECTING, COLONIZER).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MB Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted, or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the Microscopic Findings were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microscopic Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microscopic Findings CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microscopic examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microscopic examination performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MISTAT is populated using the CDASH field MIPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MIREASND).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF="N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MIPERF="Y", MISTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MICAT and MISCAT, MITPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned microbiology measurement, series of microbiology measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microscopic test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on 1 day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the Microscopic Findings were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microscopic Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microscopic Findings CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microscopic examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microscopic examination performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF="N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MIPERF="Y", MISTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MICAT and MISCAT, MITPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned microbiology measurement, series of microbiology measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microscopic test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the name (of the microscopic [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable MITESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MITEST. Both MITESTCD and MITEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the microscopic test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [microscopic measurement/test/examination] detail name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides additional details for the microscopic examination. It is recommended that the test detail be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Detail of the microscopic examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: MI Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test result, interpretation or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., reaction score for HER2).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMI dataset as the value of SUPPMI.QVAL where SUPPMI.QNAM="MICLSIG" and SUPPMI.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result category?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the category of the test results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., MALIGNANT or BENIGN, RESISTANCE VARIANT for genetic variation).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MI Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the Microscopic Findings were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microscopic Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microscopic Findings CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the Microbiology Susceptibility test performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not a microbiology susceptibility test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. For the SDTM submission dataset, the SDTMIG variable MSSTAT is populated using the CDASH field MSPERF. The question text used might be reflected in the reason not done (MSREASND).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MSSTAT. If MSPERF="N", the value of MSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MSPERF="Y", MSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MSCAT and MSSCAT, MSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD would be populated as MSALL and an appropriate test name (MSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, tests or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology susceptibility test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to confirm that the appropriate data record is present in the electronic transfer. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when specimen collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of susceptibility test (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the microbiology susceptibility test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology susceptibility category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the microbiology susceptibility finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microbiology susceptibility subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MSSCAT can only be used if there is an MSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Description of the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of Microscopic Findings were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the Microscopic Findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Microscopic Findings CRF using the date (MSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the microbiology susceptibility test performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether or not microbiology susceptibility test was performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be implemented for an entire panel. General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MSSTAT. If MSPERF = "N", the value of MSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MSPERF = "Y", MSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MSCAT and MSSCAT, MSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD would be populated as MSALL and an appropriate test name (MSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, tests or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (microbiology susceptibility test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data). May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [test/procedure/observation] link identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each microbiology susceptibility result has an identifier that will link records across domains.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This may be a one-to- one or a one-to-many relationship. For example, a single microbiology specimen or result may have multiple measurements/assessments performed (e.g., susceptibility testing).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTM Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An identifier used to link related records across domains.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) date of the (microbiology) specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of specimen collection ,represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (start) time of the the (microbiology) collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the Microbiology Susceptibility finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the Microbiology Susceptibility finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MSSCAT can only be used if there is an MSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of MSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the MSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Description.TranslatedText: MS Organism Test or Finding Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the Microbiology Susceptibility test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable MSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MSTEST. Both MSTESTCD and MSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the Microbiology Susceptibility test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the Microbiology Susceptibility Test detail?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the microbiology susceptibility test, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Provides additional details for the microbiology susceptibility test if necessary to define a unique record. It is recommended that the test detail be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Detail of the Microbiology Susceptibility Test used to obtain the measurement or finding. Helps to establish a unque record.

Description.TranslatedText: MS Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record test result, interpretation or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests the units may not be applicable (e.g., where MSTEST requires simply a qualitative result).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMS dataset as the value of SUPPMS.QVAL where SUPPMS.QNAM="MSCLSIG" and SUPPMS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the test results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result category?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the category of the test results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., "SUSCEPTIBLE", "RESISTANT").

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Used to categorize the result of a finding.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the vendor used?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the laboratory name.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab names was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the specimen material type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the condition of the specimen?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record condition of specimen.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Describes the condition of the specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the specimen was collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Description.TranslatedText: MS Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than one method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the Non-host Organism ID?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for a non-host organism that is the subject of the test.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the test. These variables were added as core SDTM variables in SDTMIG v3.3.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMS dataset as the value of SUPPMS.QVAL where SUPPMS.QNAM="NHOID" and SUPPMS.QLABEL="Non-host Organism ID". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The identifier for a non-host organism which should only be used when the organism is the subject of the test.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the name of the agent for which resistance is being tested?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the agent for which resistance is being tested.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: These variables were added as core SDTM variables in SDTMIG v3.3.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMS dataset as the value of SUPPMS.QVAL where SUPPMS.QNAM="MSAGENT" and SUPPMS.QLABEL= "Microbiology Susceptibility Agent". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of the agent for which resistance is tested

Question.TranslatedText: What was the concentration of the agent?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the concentration of the agent.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: These variables were added as core SDTM variables in SDTMIG v3.3.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMS.QVAL where SUPPMS.QNAM="MSCONC" and SUPPMS.QLABEL="MS Agent Concentration". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The concentration of the agent for which resistance is tested.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the agent concentration unit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the concentration unit of the agent.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: These variables were added as core SDTM variables in SDTMIG v3.3.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMS dataset as the value of SUPPMS.QVAL where SUPPMS.QNAM="MSCONCU" and SUPPMS.QLABEL="MS Agent Concentration Unit". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The concentration unit of the agent for which resistance is tested.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the PK samples were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the PK samples at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the PK CRF using the date (PCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were PK samples collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Check "No" if none of the samples were collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented at form level or sample level. These may be all samples of a particular type or all samples taken for some purpose and may need to be identified by the organization of the data on the form.
