Each sample collected could result in 1 or more tests performed, so there can be a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship between samples and tests/results.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT. If PCPERF="N", the value of PCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If PCPERF="Y", PCSTAT should be null. PCTEST and PCTESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., PCCAT and PCSCAT, PCTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD would be populated as PCALL and an appropriate test name (PCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not PK samples were collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Record Not Done ifthe PK sample was not collected.

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the specimen was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be one check box for each measurement. This field can be useful on individual sample collections to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the PK sample was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why a PK sample was not collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when PK sample collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If left blank, "PCDATFL" for this specimen must be populated (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The date of collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of PK sample collection or the start date of PK sample collection over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the specimen/sample collected on the same date as the [last/previous specimen/sample] [collected/collection ended]?

mdr:Prompt.TranslatedText: Same as Previous (Specimen/Sample Collection End) Date

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select when the date of this specimen collection is the same as the date of the previous specimen collected. If left blank, "PCDAT" for this specimen must be populated. (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected)

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: When a series of specimen are taken on a single form, this field is tied to the collection date to allow for the flag to be used as a surrogate for the date field. Its selection means that the date of this specimen is the same as the date of the last specimen collected (in the series). This variable may be used when collecting PK data and re-entering dates is more cumbersome than selecting the check box.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTMIG variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Flag indicating that the PK date (or start date) is the same as the previous specimen collection date (or start date).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete time is expected. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of PK sample collection or start time for a specimen collected over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for the PK sample collection, if not preprinted on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests. Examples of conditions imposed may include: Calorie fast, Fluid fast, High-fat meal, Low-fat meal, or Exercise.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM ="PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low-fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (PK) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the specimen (material) type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a PK sample.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, Ph). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If the analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the test result, interpretation or finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the PK samples were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the PK samples at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the PK CRF using the date (PCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were PK samples collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate that all of the PK samples in this group were collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented at form level or sample level. These may be all samples of a particular type or all samples taken for some purpose and may need to be identified by the organization of the data on the form. Each sample collected could result in 1 or more tests performed, so there can be a one-to-one or one-to-many relationship between samples and tests/results.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT. If PCPERF="N", the value of PCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If PCPERF="Y", PCSTAT should be null. PCTEST and PCTESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., PCCAT and PCSCAT, PCTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD would be populated as PCALL and an appropriate test name (PCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not PK samples were collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the reason the PK sample was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason why a PK sample was not collected.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text. When PCREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable PCSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when PK sample collection occurred using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If left blank, "PCDATFL" for this specimen must be populated (or "PCPERF" must be flagged to indicate this sample was not collected).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete date is expected. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of PK sample collection or the start date of PK sample collection over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the start time of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record start time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete time is expected. In interval collection, start can be added as needed to the question text, prompt and CRF directions. The SDTMIG PCDTC variable contains either a date/time when a specimen is collected at a point in time or the start date/time, when a specimen is collected over time.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of PK sample collection or start time for a specimen collected over a period of time (protocol-defined time-point range), represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the end date of the specimen collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the date when PK sample collection stopped using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The end date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end date of the specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the specimen collection end time?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record end time of collection (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A complete end time is expected. The SDTMIG variable PCENDTC variable contains the end date/time, when a specimen is collected over time. If there is no end date/time, the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC should be Null.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PCENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The end time of the specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What was the planned time point of the PK sample collection?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for the PK sample collection, if not preprinted on the CRF. Note: Planned time points are often described as relative to the dosing of the study drug.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as Planned Time Point can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors PCTPTREF (text description) and PCRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables PCTPTNUM, PCELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the subject fasting?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether the subject was fasting prior to the test being performed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether the subject was fasting. Some study treatments may have a food effect and it is important to know whether the dose was taken while the subject was fasted.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether protocol defined testing conditions were met.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information is collected when the test results may be affected by whether conditions for testing were properly met. The specific testing conditions required should be preprinted on the CRF (e.g., "Did subject meet diet requirements?"). This may not be relevant for all tests. Examples of conditions imposed may include: Calorie fast, Fluid fast, High-fat meal, Low-fat meal, or Exercise.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPC dataset as the value of SUPPPC.QVAL where SUPPPC.QNAM ="PCCOND" and SUPP.PCLABEL= "Test Condition Met". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Indication whether the testing conditions defined in the protocol were met (e.g., low fat diet).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the (PK) [reference identifier/accession number]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen or accession number assigned.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the specimen (material) type?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the specimen material type, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The type of specimen used for a PK sample.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the test name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the measurement or finding, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsors typically collect tests related to the specimen characteristics on the CRF (e.g., Volume, pH). Results for tests on an analyte (e.g., Concentration) would typically be populated when the SDTM-based datasets are created. If the analyte test results are collected on the CRF, the test would be the analyte name. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable PCTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PCTEST. The SDTMIG variables PCTESTCD and PCTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name of the analyte or specimen characteristics used to obtain the PK measurement or finding.

Description.TranslatedText: PK Sampling Result in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the test?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the PK sampling test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the result?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the PK sampling test result.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of the physical examination can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the physical examination findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included collected on the PE CRF using the date (PEDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Was the physical examination performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If physical examination was performed as planned then select Yes, otherwise, select No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. Used to ask if the physical exam was performed at the overall subject level at the specified time point. If this field is used then the result should only be mapped to PESTAT if the overall examination, at the subject level, was not performed. If the overall examination was performed, then the value of PESTAT would be null for each examined body systems and "NOT DONE" for any body systems not examined (see PERES).

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable PESTAT. If PEPERF="N" the value of PESTAT="NOT DONE". If PEPERF="Y", then the actual physical exam results would be reported by body system (see PERES). PECAT, PESCAT, PETEST and PETESTCD must reflect what tests were not done. If used for an entire CRF or other set of multiple tests with PECAT and PESCAT, PETESTCD=PEALL.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned physical examination was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was category of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the physical examination category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The CRF can capture the different types of Physical Exams using PECAT (e.g., GENERAL, OPHTHAMOLOGIC, NEUROLOGICAL). This may be preprinted on the CRF. If PECAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was subcategory of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the physical examination subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. The CRF can capture the different subtypes of PE categories using PESCAT. This may be preprinted on the CRF. If PESCAT is not collected (e.g. it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. PESCAT can only be used if there is a PECAT and it must be a subcategorization of PECAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the PECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record complete date of examination using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date of examination may be determined from the date of the visit (VISDAT) and if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date when the physical examination was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the physical examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the time of examination (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collect time if it is relevant for the analysis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable PEDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of examination, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsor-defined question]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: If collected on the CRF, sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the body system examined?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Per protocol, perform physical examinations of specified body systems.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor should pre-print all body systems to be examined on the CRF. The use of a complete list of body systems eliminates the need for another, specify category as any abnormalities identified should fall under 1 of the prespecified categories. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Body System" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable PETESTCD may be determined from the value collected in PETEST.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Name of the body system.

Question.TranslatedText: Were the results normal, abnormal, or not done?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the overall assessment for each exam category/body system listed.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the examined body system is normal then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up-front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable, then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC. When the SDTM-based datasets are created, PESTRESC is the standardized value for PEORRES and is populated for any record where PEORRES is not null. If the abnormal findings are coded using a dictionary, then PESTRESC should be the dictionary preferred term or if not coded PEORRES.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES="Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES="Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Overall assessment of examined body system.

Question.TranslatedText: If the result was abnormal, what were the findings?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record all abnormal findings for the given body system in the space provided.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If the examined body system is normal then the value in PEORRES should be "NORMAL". If the body system is not examined, then the value in PEORRES should be Null and the value in PESTAT should be "NOT DONE". If the examined body system is abnormal, then the value of PEORRES should contain the text of the abnormal findings (PEDESC). If the sponsor's data collection system allows for up front recording of the abnormality and status using a single variable then the SDTM variable name PEORRES may be used in place of CDASH variable names PERES and PEDESC.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTMIG variable PEORRES. If PERES="Normal", populate PEORRES with the value of PERES. If PERES="Abnormal", populate PEORRES with the value of PEDESC.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Text description of any abnormal findings.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the physical examination result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Was the physical examination result clinically significant? If Yes select Yes, otherwise, select No.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: If this level of information is needed for reconciliation with adverse events, this field may be added to the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPPE dataset as the value of SUPPPE.QVAL where SUPPPE.QNAM ="PECLSIG" and SUPPPE.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the physical examination abnormality is clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: Who was the evaluator?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be preprinted or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The role of the person who provided the evaluation.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the reason that data was not collected?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Provide the reason the assessment was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Captures the reason why the measurement or test was not done. The reason may be chosen from a sponsor-defined list (e.g., broken equipment, subject refused) or entered as free text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An explanation of why the data are not available.

Question.TranslatedText: What is/was the [body system/ organ system]?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: PEBODSYS should be assigned using a coding system. If included on the CRF, it is prepopulated and must be paired by the sponsor with specific prespecified verbatim terms. If not included on the CRF, PEBODSYS is assigned through the coding process.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Body System or Organ Class that is involved for a finding from the standard hierarchy for dictionary-coded results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is not a data collection field that would appear on the CRF. Sponsors will populate this through the coding process. PEMODIFY contains any modified text used for coding. Used only when the reported abnormalities in PEORRES are coded to a dictionary. This is in contrast to Events and Interventions domains where the topic variable (TERM or TRT) is modified for coding.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: If the value for PEORRES is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of Controlled Terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of physical examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the body system examined or the finding?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate the proportionality of the anatomical location of the of the abnormal finding.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific portionality for the anatomical locations. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.

Description.TranslatedText: PE Method of Test or Examination

Question.TranslatedText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the method of test or examination.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Method of the test or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a prepopulated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the subject characteristics were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the subject characteristics at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the SC CRF using the date (SCDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable SCDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the subject characteristics??

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristics category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the subject characteristics?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristics subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. SCSCAT can only be used if there is an SCCAT and it must be a subcategorization of SCCAT. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the SCCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: Were subject characteristics collected for [SCTESTCD]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if subject characteristics information was collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When the SDTM-based datasets are created, the value of SCPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable SCSTAT. If [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF ="N", the value of SCSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If [SCTESTCD]_SCPERF ="Y", SCSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., SCCAT and SCSCAT, SCTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable SCTESTCD would be assigned SCALL and an appropriate test name ( SCTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not any subject characteristics were collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the test group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on this horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain.

Description.TranslatedText: SC Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What is the subject's [SCTEST]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the subject characteristic.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the Subject Characteristics as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the visit name?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The date the VS measurements were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the VS CRF using the Vital Signs Date (VSDAT) field.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).

Question.TranslatedText: Were [vital signs/[VSTEST] performed?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital signs were collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of VSPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPERF when implemented on a specific test basis.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable VSSTAT. If VSPERF="N", the value of VSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If VSPERF="Y", VSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., VSCAT and VSSCAT, VSTPT) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable VSTESTCD would be populated as VSALL and an appropriate test name (VSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the date of the measurement(s)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record date of measurements using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single date may be collected for all the vital sign measurements when they are performed on the same date. The date of each measurement can also be collected for each measurement using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSDAT. The date of the measurements may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the time of the measurement(s)?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record time of measurement (as complete as possible).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single collection time (e.g., VSTIM) may be collected for all the measurements when they are performed at the same time. The time of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSTIM.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable VSDTC in ISO 8601 format.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).

Question.TranslatedText: What was the category of the vital signs?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital signs category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital signs subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. VSSCAT can only be used if there is a VSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of VSCAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the vital signs group identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on the same horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.

Description.TranslatedText: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

Question.TranslatedText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the planned time point labels for vital signs, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Planned time points are needed to differentiate multiple sequential assessments. It is recommended that time points should be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Planned Time Point" can be included as the column header. The planned time point of each measurement can also be collected using a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSTPT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. See SDTMIG for additional information on representing time points. The SDTMIG time point anchors VSTPTREF (text description) and VSRFTDTC (date/time) may be needed, as well as SDTMIG variables VSTPTNUM, VSELTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.

Question.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [VSTEST] measurement was not done

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single "Not Done" can be collected once for all the tests on the same horizontal record using VSSTAT. The value of VSSTAT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, for each test "NOT DONE" may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".

Description.TranslatedText: VS Result or Finding in Original Units

Question.TranslatedText: What was the result of the [VSTEST] measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the vital sign results.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] e.g., SYSBP or [TESTCD]_VSORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the VS test code e.g., SYSBP_VSORRES. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. In addition to the SDTMIG variable VSORRES, create VSTESTCD from the CDASH variable name and determine the value of VSTEST from VSTESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the VSTEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the unit of the [VSTEST] measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select the original unit in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: A single Unit field can be collected once for all measurements collected on the same horizontal record using VSUNIT. The value of VSUNIT applies to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed for each measurement, unit may be collected using the CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT. Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: Was the [VSTEST] result clinically significant?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record whether vital sign result was clinically significant.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: In horizontal data collection, a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSCLSIG may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF if needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPVS dataset as the value of SUPPVS.QVAL where SUPPVS.QNAM = "VSCLSIG" and SUPPVS.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether the vital signs results were clinically significant.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the position of the subject during the [VSTEST] measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the position of subject at time of test (e.g. SITTING).

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Results may be affected by whether conditions for vital signs as specified in the protocol were properly met. One common condition is the subject's position. If the protocol requires this type of information, then a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSPOS may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the anatomical location where the [VSTEST] measurement was taken?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record or select location on body where measurement was performed, if not preprinted on CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Collected or preprinted when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location (e.g., ARM for blood pressure). Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. In horizontal data collection, a CDASH variable [VSTESTCD]_VSLOC may be created for each VSTESTCD and added to the CRF, if needed. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement.

Question.TranslatedText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [VSTEST] measurement?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: May be preprinted or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the study identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What is the site identifier?

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique identifier for a site within a study.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the identifier for the subject.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.

Description.TranslatedText: Findings About Object of the Observation

Question.TranslatedText: [Sponsored-defined phrase]

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: [Protocol specific]

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: The FAOBJ will usually be preprinted or hidden, and not solicited as an actual question. These FA domains are usually created by the sponsor.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A description of the object or focal point of the findings observation that is represented by FATEST.

Question.TranslatedText: Has the subject had any [Findings topic(s)] (after/before [study specific time frame])?; [Was/Were] (there) any [Findings topic(s)] (reported) (after/before [study specific time frame])?; Were all eligibility criteria met?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the there are findings. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This is a field that can be used in any CRF to indicate whether or not there is data to record. Used primarily as a data cleaning field. This provides verification that all other fields on the CRF were deliberately left blank. FAPERF should be used to capture a response about whether planned measurements, tests, observations were done.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Does not map to an SDTM variable. The SDTM aCRF is annotated to indicate that this field is NOT SUBMITTED.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication whether or not any data was collected for the finding topic.

Question.TranslatedText: [Were any/Was the] [FATEST/topic] ([measurement(s)/test(s)/examination(s)/specimen(s)/sample(s))] [performed/collected]?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Indicate if the [FATESTs] was/were collected. If yes, include the appropriate details where indicated on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: This field is used to capture a response to whether or not a planned measurement, test or observation was performed. A negative response can be collected as "N" and mapped to the FASTAT variable in SDTM as "NOT DONE".

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: This field does not map directly to an SDTM variable. May be used to populate a value into the SDTM variable FASTAT. If the CDASH variable FAPERF="N", the value of the STDM variable FASTAT is "OT DONE". If FAPERF="Y", FASTAT is null. A combination of SDTM variables (e.g., FACAT and FASCAT, FATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable FATESTCD would be populated with FAALL and an appropriate test name (FATEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: An indication of whether or not a planned measurement, series of measurements, test, observation or specimen was performed or collected.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the name (of the [measurement/test/examination])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the name of the FATEST if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTM variable FATESTCD may be determined from the value collected in FATEST. The SDTMIG variables FATESTCD and FATEST are required in SDTM.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: Descriptive name for the test being performed.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [measurement/test/examination] detail name?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the detail of the [FATEST], if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: It is recommended that the test detail name be preprinted on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test," "Test Name" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A further description of FATESTCD and FATEST.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [type/category/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the FA category, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.

mdr:MappingInstructions.TranslatedText: Maps directly to the SDTM variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.

mdr:Definition.TranslatedText: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.

Question.TranslatedText: What [is/was] the [type/subcategory/name] (of the [measurement/test/examination/specimen/sample])?

mdr:CRFCompletionInstructions.TranslatedText: Record the FA subcategory, if not preprinted on the CRF.

mdr:ImplementationNotes.TranslatedText: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a preprinted category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. FASCAT can only be used if there is a FACAT and it must be a subcategorization of FACAT.
